description: From Middle English berkyng, berkande, equivalent to bark +‎ -ing.

adjectives.description: barking (comparative more barking, superlative most barking)

examples: Synonyms: three stops short of Dagenham; see also Thesaurus:insane
He’s going to run the marathon in this hot weather dressed as Donald Duck – he must be barking!

description: From Middle English berkyng, berking, berkynge, equivalent to bark +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: The action of the verb to bark.
examples: Old pigtailed seamen would tell of horseshoes found in the meat casks; of curious barkings and neighings heard in the slaughter-houses; and of negroes who disappeared near the victualling yards, to be seen no more.
